headline: Alphabet's Google could be an AI loser, says portfolio manager
summary: STORY: "I've completely shifted the way I spend time with regard to search and with regard to looking for information. Most of my day is spent on ChatGPT, which is a huge assistant, and much less of my day is spent using Google search. So there will be winners and losers from AI," said Shaposhnik."We happen to own Microsoft and Broadcom, both businesses we think will benefit greatly from AI over the next half decade to decade," he added.

headline: Nvidia and 2 Other Chip Stocks to Play AI Into Earnings, Says J.P. Morgan
summary: Robust demand for artificial-intelligence chips makes for attractive buying opportunities in several semiconductor stocks headed into earnings season, according to J.P. Morgan.  “AI/accelerated compute demand remains strong,” analyst Harlan Sur wrote on Friday.  Sur said his top chip-stock ideas are  Nvidia Broadcom  and  Marvell Technology  He has an Overweight rating on all three.

headline: Is Europe losing the AI race? Magnificent Seven widen gap over Europe's giants
summary: The US ‘Magnificent Seven’ have pulled far ahead of Europe’s corporate giants, driven by massive AI growth. While US tech surges, Europe’s top firms—mostly in traditional sectors—struggle to keep pace in the new innovation-driven economy.View on euronews

headline: Indian Apple reseller Ample to grow revenue by a third as it expands presence, portfolio, CEO says
summary: (Reuters) -Indian Apple reseller Ample is banking on store expansion and adding more brands and clients to achieve 35% revenue growth in fiscal year 2026, its chief executive said.  The Bengaluru-based firm, which supplies tech products such as Apple computers to over 1,500 clients including SAP, Broadcom, Infosys, and Wipro, operates more than 120 stores across India.  Nearly 50 of these sell Apple products, while others showcase brands like Under Armour and ASICS.
